Senior Software Developer GoDaddy.com July 2009  –  August 2012  (3 years 2 months) Tempe, Arizona, USA As part of the Productivity Applications group I am the primary maintainer of GoDaddy's Webmail and MobileMail software products (PHP, Javascript, Smarty) which have many millions of customer accounts. I also plan and lead most of the production deployments of these two products with a team of Developer(s), QA, and Ops personnel to deploy the latest code changes into production.  
 
In the past I have assisted with development of the cross-product Single-Sign-On system, creating new feature code and debugging existing issues primarily in Object-Oriented PHP and Javascript, having written about 60% of the Unit Tests for it as well. 
 
AJAX and SOAP are heavily used in these modern web-based products, as well as scaling out sophisticated MySQL installations. 
 
In 2011 I planned and led a corporate “brainstorming” session (a team of 4) to come up with a set of product usability guidelines, with practical suggestions on how to improve our products to meet those guidelines. 
 
I also presented numerous 1 hour Tech Talks to our department of 25+ technical contributors on a variety of topics over the years, including: SPDY protocol, NoSQL database design and benefits, PHP 5.4 release changes, and more. Owner and Lead Developer Fastech Web Solutions July 2006  –  February 2010  (3 years 8 months) Mesa, Arizona, USA Owned and operated a 1-man company doing web site and database design and development. I use my experience with LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, and PHP/Perl) to create sophisticated, custom web-based solutions using a database backend. I host some of these web sites securely on my own Linux servers. 
 
I negotiated contracts with customers for new web development projects, planned and scheduled the work, designed and implemented the database, outsourced projects to other developers that I didn’t have time to do myself, and brought in Graphic Designers and on-line marketing people (SEO, PPC) for projects that required it.
